definition: subordinates in gang of bandits
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
variant of 嘍囉|喽啰[lou2 luo5]
variant of 出婁子|出娄子[chu1 lou2 zi5]
hello (loanword)
bandit
variant of 婁子|娄子[lou2 zi5]
variant of 惹婁子|惹娄子[re3 lou2 zi5]
variant of 捅婁子|捅娄子[tong3 lou2 zi5]

sentences.english: Of course it's the bride's sister group.
sentences.chinese: 当然是新娘子的姐妹团喽。

sentences.english: Naturally, Wolowitz is overcome with paranoia and insecurity.
sentences.chinese: 洛维兹自然会变得多疑而没有安全感喽。

sentences.english: So are you planning to spend the summer sweating it out in Brooklyn?
sentences.chinese: 那你的暑假就准备在布鲁克林苦熬喽？

sentences.english: The island canyon scenery looks endlessly, the echo ripples between the white clouds.
sentences.chinese: 岛峡风光看不尽啦，回声荡漾白云间喽。

sentences.english: You can, of course, buy oil producers.
sentences.chinese: 当然喽，你可以购买石油生产股。

sentences.english: If you have an auto transmission, you’re lucky.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用的是自动变速器，那就幸福喽。

sentences.english: Yes, the other families in the audience will make fun of it.
sentences.chinese: 当然喽，观众席里的其他家庭也许会取笑我们。

sentences.english: Aardvark. ?Yes, the other families in the audience will make fun of it.
sentences.chinese: 当然喽，观众席里的其他家庭也许会取笑我们。

sentences.english: You might have talked to me more when you came to dinner.
sentences.chinese: 那么，你来吃饭的那一次，也可以跟我多谈谈喽。

sentences.english: We can only pray that Microsoft and all the other software vendors will agree.
sentences.chinese: 我们只能祈盼微软和别的软件卖家会同意喽。
“谢谢喽，”科利回答说，“你是一位君子。

sentences.english: Doctor, are you suggesting the pain is a figment of my imagination?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你是说这疼痛是我想像出来的喽？

sentences.english: Now, apparently, the worm has turned.
sentences.chinese: 显然，现在这条喂大的蛇反咬人喽。

sentences.english: "Surely you know what a kiss is?" she asked, aghast.
sentences.chinese: “你当然知道什么叫吻喽？”温迪吃惊地问。

sentences.english: I don't like the way you slurp noisily when you eat noodles.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢你吃面条时的“嗤喽”声。

definition: (phonetic)
to cough up/also pr. [ka3]
(final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
a Pekinese/a pug/(dialect) to scold
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
(onom.) laughing out loud
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
hey
Oh!
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
oh (interjection indicating doubt or surprise)
to chant
hee hee/happy
Oh! (exclamation of dismay etc)/see 呦呦[you1 you1]
(onom.) he he/mischievous laughter
(sentence-final particle expressing exhortation)/(syllable filler in a song)
Oh! (interjection indicating slight surprise)
(onom.) smack!
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
